page.title: 15Agriculture of the area
page.content: Farm Study- Park Farm,Wherstead Size-the farm consists of 750 ha.It is an amalgam of several smaller farms and is run as an estate. Soil type-Light sandy, acid soils based on glacial outwash. In need of regular liming and use of chemical fertilizers. Land Use-300 ha. wheat, 50 ha. maize, 60 ha.barley, 60 ha. O.S. rape,120 ha. sugar beet, 40 ha. oats, 120 ha. woodland, grass, buildings etc. Livestock -200 dairy cattle (red and white Friesian) 1800 pigs (hybrid breeds), farrowing carried out on farm. Markets -wheat, cattle food, flour, bran (Cranfields Ltd. main buyer) -barley, cattle food,malting (Paul's malting). -sugar beet (BSC Sproughton) -milk, (Colchester Co-op Dairy) -beef and pork (local markets) Highly mechanized & capital intensive.
